result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ka Chai Khang in court with attorney Sheila Janelle Kessler. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard at this time are 15CF-153, 15CF-265, 15CF-264, 15CF-263, 15CF-267, 14CF-425, 15CF-7 and 15CF-266.

9:40 AM Court calls cases.
Court states appearances. 

Matter is set for a plea hearing.

There is an agreement.
14CF-425: Defendant will plead to Count 1. Count 2 and Count 3 would be dismissed and read in
Parties are anticipating a PSI. Both sides would be free to argue.
15CF-263: Defendant will plead to Count 1 and Count 6. Counts 2-5 and 7-10 would be dismissed and read in
15CF-264: Defendant will plead to Count 1. Counts 2-5 would be dismissed and read in
15CF-265: Defendant will plead to Count 1 and Count 5. Counts 2-4 and 6-12 would be dismissed and read in
15CF-266: Defendant will plead to Count 2. Count 1 and 3-6 would be dismissed and read in
15CF-7, 15CF-153 and 15CF-267 would be dismissed and read in

Atty Kessler concurs.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed for each file.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
14CF-425: Count 1: NO CONTEST
15CF-263: Count 1: NO CONTEST
15CF-263: Count 6: NO CONTEST
15CF-264: Count 1: NO CONTEST
15CF-265: Count 1: NO CONTEST
15CF-265: Count 5: NO CONTEST
15CF-266: Count 2: NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding pleas.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Kessler  for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.
State has complied with victim notification statutes.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
14CF-425: Count 1: Contrary to the statute section stated therein
14CF-425: Counts 2-3: Dismissed and Read In
15CF-263: Count 1: Contrary to the statute section stated therein
15CF-263: Count 6: Contrary to the statute section stated therein
15CF-263: Counts 2-5 and Counts 7-10: Dismissed and Read In
15CF-264: Count 1: Contrary to the statute section stated therein
15CF-264: Counts 2-5: Dismissed and Read In
15CF-265: Count 1: Contrary to the statute section stated therein
15CF-265: Count 5: Contrary to the statute section stated therein
15CF-265: Counts 2-4 and Counts 6-12: Dismissed and Read In
15CF-266: Count 2: Contrary to the statute section stated therein
15CF-266: Count 1 and Counts 3-6: Dismissed and Read In
15CF-7: Dismissed and Read In
15CF-153: Dismissed and Read In
15CF-267: Dismissed and Read In


BY THE COURT:
Court will order a PSI. 

Sentencing hearing will be May 27, 2016 at 9:00 AM for 1 hour.

BY THE COURT:
PSI to be completed by May 13, 2016.
Copies to be forwarded to counsel.
Bond and conditions of bond are ordered continued.

Defendant Ka Chai Khang appeared by video and attorney Sheila Janelle Kessler did not appear. Defendant Ka Chai Khang in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 14CF425, 15CF7, 15CF153, 15CF263, 15CF264, 15CF265, 15CF266 and 15CF267.

1:22 p.m.  Court calls case and states the appearances.
Court makes statements to the defendant; questions her where she was for her plea/sentencing hearing.
Defendant makes statements that she was in the Wood County Jail.
Defendant has new address in Wisconsin Rapids.
Court continues to question the defendant.
Atty Knaapen makes statements in regards to bond. 
Court states that a $1,500 bond had been posted by someone other than the defendant.
Defendant makes statements regarding her $1,500 bond.
Court questions the defendant as to what her sentence was in Shawano County; she has not been sentenced in Wood County as of yet.
Atty Knaapen requests an additional $500 cash bond with recommendations as stated on the record.
Defendant makes additional statements.
Atty Knaapen makes additional statements regarding bond.
Court questions what the bond's were in additional cases as there appears to have been cash bond's on 15CF153 abd 15CF263,
Atty Knaapen reviews his files and makes a statement.
Court states the status of the cases for the defendant.

BTC:
The bond monies previously posted covered all of the above listed cases as per the Court.
Warrants quashed. 

  Plea hearing scheduled for March 1, 2016 at 09:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Ka Chai Khang
Current: 311 Pepper Avenue, Wisconsin Rapids, WI 54494 United States  (Effective: 02-03-2016)
Prior: 3030 Post Road, Plover, WI 54467

Atty Sheila Kessler appears in Court.  Defendant Ka Chai Khang does not appear.  David Knaapen appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 14CF425, 15CF7, 15CF153, 15CF263, 15CF264, 15CF265, 15CF266 and 15CF267

10:28 a.m.  Court calls case and states the appearances.
Court questions Atty Kessler as to where her client is; Atty Kessler indicates she is in the Wood County Jail.
Atty Knaapen makes statements and is requesting a warrant be issued.
Atty Kessler makes additional statements.

BY THE COURT:
Bench Warrant issued on all files. 
Body Only

Defendant Ka Chai Khang in court with attorney Sheila Janelle Kessler. Defendant Ka Chai Khang in custody. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing on cases 15CF266, 15CF264, 15CF263, 15CF265, and 15CF267.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

Arraignment for each case heard today:   State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Ka Chai Khang appeared by video.  Attorney Acalia Halverson in court who appears for Atty Kessler. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All files heard: 15CF263, 15CF264, 15CF265, 15CF266, 15CF267

Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
